title: Honor Student At Texas High School Jailed For Missing School (Diane Tran)

comments.text:

yeah right that is outrageous. She has to make sure her siblings are ok. I 
hope this beautiful girl gets into college and gets into the medical field.﻿

comments.author: Cory Coleman

comments.text:
+Cory Coleman Nah. Mostly just Texas in this situation. Our state has more 
lenient policies. If she lived here she would be sent a letter, or maybe a 
phone call asking why she has missed x amount of days. Worst case scenario 
is that the school calls the police to go check on her home to make sure 
everything is alright (only if she didn't respond). Hell, if she had a 
really good reason (which she did) she could talk to the school counselor 
and reorganize her school schedule. But in Texas they just jail you first, 
ask questions later.

comments.author: Aminals

comments.text:
I was always late to my 1st class in middle school (I'm in Texas) because 
my brother was always making us late. Here 3 tardies equals 1 absence. I 
racked up 13 absences without missing a single day of school. I had to go 
to court and I had to take a 8 hour class where they basically said if you 
miss school you'll become a druggie homeless person who ends up in and out 
of prison. ﻿
comments.author: IndustrialCOMMIE

comments.text: That judge is such TRASH! ﻿
comments.author: Ahman Millener

comments.text:
I have IGA Deficiency which causes me to get sick a lot, the stupid 
principle at my school was about to make me retake senior year because of 
that. Even though, I passed all of my classes and made up all of my work. I 
even got out of class one semester early because I finished everything. I 
later found out that the reason why he wanted me to retake that year is 
because he got payed better when he has good passing students. HE WANTED TO 
MAKE ME RETAKE MY SENIOR YEAR BECAUSE I WAS A GOOD STUDENT, AND IT UPPED 
HIS PAYCHECK. WHAT THE FUCK. Later he agreed to let me graduate. Then 2 
days before graduation, I got a phone call from him. He told me I cannot 
graduate because he forgot to tell me that I had to take some math class to 
graduate. I can not believe a man like him is allowed to be a principle. I 
was able to walk on graduation day but I had to do summer classes, even 
though I had got out of classes early that year. Complete bullshit, the 
USA's schools are rubbish. From all that I ended up having anxiety and 
decided to not go to college. I hope this girl is able to get out of high 
school as soon as possible.﻿

comments.text:
This makes no sense. I was told by my high school when I had missed a ton 
of classes for health reasons, that the PARENTS will get in trouble, not 
the student. You're still legally their responsibility until you're 18, and 
if she was 17 at the time her PARENTS should have been taken into custody 
for not only failing to get her to school but for ABANDONING their children 
and leaving the state. This whole story is fucked up.﻿

comments.text:

schooling, once you're over that age you're responsible for your own

is, we can't really say anything. Now I whole-heartily agree the parents 
should be taken into custody for abandoning there own children(and why 
nothing been done about).

comments.text:
How’s Texas doing? Not so great: The state ranks 50th in percentage of high 
school graduates among its populace high school graduation rate, first in

comments.author: fred flinstone

comments.text: Outrageous! Stupid judge.﻿
comments.author: Paul TheSkeptic

comments.text:
Yes. This is exactly the answer. Instead of helping this poor girl who's 
been abandoned by her parents (who, by the way, are the ones who should be 
in prison for abandoning her and her siblings), let's throw her in jail 
because god fucking forbid she miss a few days of school to pay the bills 
and put food on the table for her family. God fucking forbid she get a pass 
because she's doing the right goddamn thing. Would they rather she drop out 
of school? I mean, it's possible that this judge's inability to look at 
this like a human being has cost her any chance she had at getting into a 
good medical school, or maybe medical school in general. You can't get into 
trouble like this and wind up in jail if you want any kind of career in the 
medical field. They'll see you as a delinquent. Colleges don't give a damn 
why you did what you did, why you wound up in jail, why you had to pay a 
fine, or anything like they. All they care about is the fact that you did.﻿
comments.author: UnhappyMealXD

comments.text:
When I heard he say Diane Tran was an honor student, I immediately thought 
of Kevin Tran.﻿

comments.text: The poor dog will be dinner﻿

comments.text:
well the judge just has no heart he lives by the books, dude as a judge you

comments.author: Sputer Head

comments.text:
+Sputer Head Actually the jail record doesn't have to keep her out of 
college. She can pay $30 and get it expunged from her record. As long as 
this is the only charge then all she has to do is show her Diploma and pay 
the $30 and it'll get expunged. Then she doesn't even have to tell the 
University that it ever happened, and the court isn't allowed to tell them. 
But I do agree with you in that it shouldn't have to have gotten to that 
point.

comments.author: Brendan McCaffery

comments.text: Did anyone else notice that the Judge's name was Moriarty?﻿
comments.author: Lydia Lewis (CloudyTwister)

comments.text:
I went to Willis, she was in my class and I personally knew her. I remember 
she always fell asleep in class and it wasn't before long I understood why. 
She was indeed juggling some parts of her life to extents most people can't 
even handle, and it really was quite impressive to me. Also, I need to note 
that she was particularly smart. As far as being a Willis district student 
all of my public school life (now a sophomore at a university) and dealing 
with the city of Willis bureaucracy, I can attest to the fact that things 
are pretty.....messed up. The judge is terrible. I had a friend who was in 
possession of two xanex pills which were his cousin's. His cousin forgot 
his prescription at home and my friend had arrived late to bring the two 
pills. He was arrested and charged with two felonies, one per pill by that 
same judge. I advise you all to stay out of Willis, Tx. I am not proud to 
have gone to school there.﻿

but rather limits these people from continuing on with their education

comments.author: Adam Tsovko

comments.text:
This judge is so stupid, ignorant just an ass hole. This young girl is a 
fine example of a hard working girl who is trying to survive and persist 
despite the sudden disappearance of her parents. She took on 
responsibilities well beyond what most people her age are expected to take 
on. And yet this stupid judge, with honestly a lame excuse says that he has 
the right to jail her?! Even if it is just for a day, employers look at 
someone's record and when they see jail sentence, they immediately 
disqualifies that person from getting the job. That lawyer honestly should 
go to prison himself for doing this to the young girl. ﻿

comments.text: You can go to jail for missing school? Why was I not death sentenced?﻿

comments.text: What an asshole judge. A crime to miss class? TF??﻿
comments.author: Shaahida Pierre

comments.text: Her parents put her in jail for missing school and getting a b
comments.author: League Legends

comments.text:
Lol I've missed class before and I was never thrown in jail for it. Some of

comments.author: Shaahida Pierre

comments.text: Its not the judge its the law
comments.author: League Legends

comments.text:
Racist US. Here we go again. This girl was doing her best to succeed, and 
the judge puts her in jail. She wasn't being truant because she was a gang 
member. She wasn't getting bad grades. For Gods Sake! She was working two 
jobs and a honor student. She should be applauded for her efforts. But, 
wait, she isn't white. So, the judge doesn't care and you better tow the 
line as a minority, or serve jail time. He wants to make a example of her, 
for what? I'll tell you. For trying too hard. It's always a zero tolerance 
policy when its a minority. It's the same as the white sheriffs who 
harassed the black kid 60+ times at work. Why do I still love this country?﻿
comments.author: Chas UGC

comments.text:
+Chas UGC
You realize it's cheaper to pay somebody to lay railroad tracks and make 
license plates than it is to clothe them, house them, feed them, and hire 
security personnel to watch them, correct? You realize running a full on 
prison facility is WAY more expensive than the "profits" they get from the 
prisoners IN the prisons?

Oh please. When you actually have proof that black people are arrested for 
no reason in some sort of government ploy to make money (when the 
government does the EXACT OPPOSITE on the endeavor), come talk to me. But I 
don't see how black people having skewed crime statistics means the system 
is corrupted considering it's next to impossible and highly unlikely to 
arrest somebody for homicide for NO reason.

Face facts, there are just more black criminals than there are other races. 
For what reason, I don't know. Poverty most likely.
comments.author: AnBr9698

comments.text:
+AnBr9698
Who do you think were making the license plates for quite a while and 
probably still in some states? Who do you think worked laying railroad 
tracks? Why do you think that the government were making false charges 
against black people? It was so they could get free labor from them in 
prison. Did you ever see the movie "Slavery By Another Name"? I doubt it. 
It's not that easy to do these days. But, it is still being done. Did you 
hear about Ferguson? Where 90% of traffic stops and arrests are for black 
people. Now, that's racial profiling to an extreme. And, you don't think 
its not going on all across the U.S.? Come on, don't be naive. The police 
are targeting black people across the U.S., beating and killing them. We 
are on the verge of another Civil war. There is civil unrest across the 
U.S. in many cities. It is a powder keg, just waiting to explode.
comments.author: Chas UGC

comments.text:
+zekeman76
The people who run the prisons don't make money off of prisoners. They lose 
it. Federally run prisons have to PAY to make the prisoners live, with 
taxpayer money.

comments.text:
+jeffeharkins
Derogatory name calling now, huh? Well, you will never convince me that 
way. In fact, I believe it proves my point. I must have hit a sensitive 
mark when I said that your main target is probably Obama. You call me 
garbage, and I could call you ignorant. "Nor the presidents before him", 
huh? Well, I guess the Emancipation Proclamation signed by Abraham Lincoln 
wasn't a good thing, right? Holding people in slavery is a good thing to 
you, right? And, I guess the Civil Rights Bill wasn't a good thing either. 
The country was at the brink of another civil war before that bill. People 
were marching in the streets and the police were attacking them viciously. 
Presidents do a lot of good things for this country. It's just that right 
now, there is a big political battle going on between Obama and the 
Republicans. Obama wants to help the people and the Republicans want to 
help the big businessman, and the wealthy doctors and wealthy corporations. 
Then, you add that race thing to the equation, which for some reason, 
always exists in America, and all reason is forgotten.

comments.text:
You don't seem to realize that we have already had one civil war in this 
country based on slavery, IE racism. Slavery is probably one of the most 
vicious forms of racism. And, we nearly had another one in the '60's. This 
is probably why they killed MLK Jr. He was bringing the blacks and whites 
together against racism and bigotry, so, they killed him. He had the whites 
and blacks marching together against the bigoted police systems, government 
voting systems(IE Government), and the world was seeing it. YOU HAVE THE 
NERVE to say that blacks commit more crimes against whites? You should be 
ashamed of yourself. Whites whipped, hung, enslaved and raped blacks at 
least until the civil rights bills. White cops in New York stuck a broom 
stick up a black man's anus. White Guys dragged a black man to his death in 
Texas. We also have Rodney King. We have Treyvon Martin. Sure, we have 
felony crimes which is used as a way to deny blacks jobs in America. But, 
what happens when you don't have a criminal record as a black person. What 
happens when you are highly skilled. I'll tell you. They find other ways to 
deny you, based on your race. One question they might ask a poor person is, 
"Do you have reliable transportation?" Why the heck does that matter, if 
you get to your job on time. Or, how about, the question of how you would 
handle certain situations as a black person. Questions which are not asked 
to white people because they wouldn't have to face those sort of hostile 
situations. How about when you are in a room alone and an employer walks in 
calling your name, and ignoring you as the only person in the room. Oh no, 
a black person cannot possibly be that skilled, so they ignore you. You 
know that you won't be getting that job. They don't want to recognize or 
even see you. And when they give you that look of racism, like the one that 
white lady gave Eddie Murphy in 48 hours, you know you won't be getting 
that job.
comments.author: Chas UGC

comments.text:
+Chas UGC (some) Blacks are not considered second class human beings 
because of whites. Certain groups of them are considered second class human 
beings for one major reason. Everywhere they reside in high numbers, crime 
rates go up. This is not racism or hate talking, the statistics speak on 
their own. Degenerate black youth commit crime early in life, end up in 
jail, with a criminal record. Therefore, they can no longer work a normal 
job, and have to resort to stealing from those better off than themselves 
to support their lifestyle/family/drug habits. I firmly believe that the 
entire prison/court system needs to be reworked. It's a shame that a 18 
year old kid can ruin his life (criminal record) because of one stupid 
choice, then be forced to either turn to a life of crime, or beg employers 
to hire them.

Take Detroit, for example. The Motor City, one of the most iconic, and 
"white-bred" cities in America. Most of the law abiding people fled once 
their neighborhood became a cess pool of robbery, theft, intimidation, 
frequent distant gun shots and murder, leaving the thieves/drug 
addicts/gangs free reign. I'm not going to state their skin color, but take 
a guess. Watch a youtube channel called The Shea Show to see what happened 
to Detroit after 5 more years of O-dictator in charge. Crime is so bad in 
Detroit that, according to police, an break-in is not even considered a 
priority unless there was personal injury.

Those hate crimes being done to the people you mentioned are terrible, 
unforgivable things. But you have singled those two out, when in reality, 
Black people have killed off more of their own kind, and more white people 
than the other way around.  All of the black-on-black, and black-on-white 
crime seems to be brushed under the rug, hidden by the media, etc...,but 
when the tables turn, it becomes a HUGE, widely covered media event, for 
some reason. Not to "go there", but do you know how many "treyvon" 
situations happen every day, but with the skin color reversed? Probably 
not, because they NEVER see the light of day. Just FYI, there was a white 
person gunned down by a black guy 1 county away from Ferguson, DURING the 
riots, etc...., but the media didn't give a single shit.

What white society did during the slave trade many decades ago was utterly 
appalling, but why does the present-day white population deserve to be held 
responsible? If all of these decades of hate, bitterness, and false 
judgement continues (in both directions) I fear that it will cause a REAL 
race war, which, once it starts, will spiral out of control.
comments.author: cam94z28

comments.text:
+Chas UGC There's a difference. Someone who pleads insanity is saying that 
they either cannot control their actions or that they have no recollection 
of the crime due to some kind of mental defect. Not everyone that commits a 
crime is insane, some people are just cold, heartless people, or possibly 
psychopaths or sociopaths depending on the crime.

Do I hope I never cross the line into being insane? Of course I do. But you 
need to realize that not everyone who kills or commits a heinous crime is 
crazy, some are just flat out mean and have no remorse for what they did.
comments.author: UnhappyMealXD

comments.text:
+UnhappyMealXD
The question that I would put to you is, "Is any one totally sane who 
commits a violent crime?" "Are people who do drive by's sane?"
All that I am saying is that it is a very fine line, that I hope that I 
never cross. And, I would hope that you feel the same.
comments.author: Chas UGC

comments.text:
+Chas UGC I never said it happens often, but there have been people who 
have gotten off or gotten a lighter sentence just because they have a 
mental illness or something. I wasn't referring to temporary insanity 
because those people don't deserve jail time if, for instance, someone 
breaks in and kills or rapes their child and they snap when they find that 
person and they kill them. That's a good reason to kill because they're in 
you house and are harming or have just harmed your family members, though 
that would most likely be self-defense. But if someone is proven unfit to 
stand trial, they will not do as much time, if any, as someone who went to 
trial. My point is that there are a lot of people who deserve to be in 
prison or jail way more than this honor student and some of them will never 
get there.
comments.author: UnhappyMealXD

comments.text:
+UnhappyMealXD I don't think you understand the plea. It's not a free pass. 
Those found insane normally have to serve time in a mental facility. They 
would only be released when they are no longer a danger to society. Look at 
Charles Manson, for example, who is obviously crazy, but he will never be 
safe to let go. If someone tries to kill your family, and while they are in 
your house, you temporarily loss your mind, that can result in innocent by 
reason of insanity. Not violent unprovoked cases like Charles Manson.
comments.author: Chas UGC

comments.text:
+Chas UGC I take it you've never heard the phrase "not guilty by reason of 
insanity". If it can be proven beyond a reasonable doubt that the person 
cannot be held responsible for their actions because of a mental illness, 
the charges may be dropped, but it's more likely that the jury will find 
the person not guilty by reason of insanity or mental defect. It's not 
often that it happens, but it does happen. 

Also, some of the smartest people you'll meet are psychopaths or 
sociopaths. Most serial killers fall into one, or both, of these 
categories. They may not be book smart, but they're street smart. They 
understand how to fake emotion and understand. They know how to manipulate 
people and might sometimes avoid even being considered a suspect at first. 
They seem to live normal lives, have families, hold great jobs, and are 
seen as upstanding citizens in their community. Now, don't confuse my first 
two statements as me saying that all psychopaths or sociopaths are serial 
killers because they're not. One in every 25 people you'll meet within your 
lifetime will be a psychopath, but not all of them are dangerous.
comments.author: UnhappyMealXD

comments.text:
I remember this from ages ago. The judge should be stripped of his job 
entitlements and given the sack for being such a massive fucking moron. She 
was looking after her siblings are both of her parents decided to split and 
not face their responsibilities like real adults should. They can't be that 
loving if they're going to do that to their own flesh and blood; they're 
actually better without them if that is the case.

But the main concern about this case is that girl's family could have 
easily been split up and placed into foster care, where they'll suffer 
through years of uncertainty and possible abuse. Their future could very 
well be damaged beyond repair by a system which doesn't give a flying shit 
about their humanity or their rights. 

The fool judge should be commending her for looking out for her siblings. 
It was a mature and noble thing what she did, and if the judge can't see 
that, then perhaps those who can should shove his gavel where the sun 
doesn't shine and refuse the stupid cunt painkillers so he can see the 
error of his retarded ways.  ﻿
